intro: Carex aristata var. imberbis, commonly known as the smooth sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets of flowers. It typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
